description: Dive into "Chandigarh's Architectural Wonders Unveiled" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chandigarh's Architectural Wonders Unveiled

places.generalDescription: The Government Museum and Art Gallery in Chandigarh is a must-visit museum complex that showcases a diverse range of exhibits, including ancient and modern art, architecture, natural history, Gandharan sculptures, terracotta heads from ancient India, medieval metal sculptures, miniature paintings, manuscripts, textiles from across the Indian subcontinent and more. The museum also houses a collection of artwork by renowned artists.

sources.snippet: Government Museum and Art Gallery | #5 of 12 Best Historical Places in Chandigarh. The Government Museum and Art Gallery came into existence due to the Partition of 1947. When the country was divided into India and Pakistan, the rich collection of artifacts housed at the Central Museum in Lahore was also divided between the two countries.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Chandigarh with Location & Entry Fee

sources.snippet: This museum has an amazing collection of Gandharan sculptures, Pahari and Rajasthani paintings. It is a premier museum of North India that has its roots from the partition of India in August 1947. Before the partition, all the art and paintings were secured in the Central Museum.
sources.shortName: Secretariat Building, Chandigarh, India: Facts, Architecture

places.name: Government Museum and Art Gallery

reviews.text: Sharing with you some of the pictures I enjoyed the art gallery is a highlight of this entire establishment. Who knew you could buy an experience so vivid for 30 rs. Tickets could be bought online or from counter if you wish the museum has a shop for sale of replicas which I consider are of good quality. Please be informed the closing time is 4:30 and you need 1.5 hrs min for exploring the entire area

This museum has two parts viz. Art museum and Natural history museum out of which only Natural history museum is great. This museum was formerly known as Museum of human evolution. It is such an amazing museum where you will know how the earth was born and evolved till today, how human evolved and how dinasaurs evolved and destroyed. The sculptures are damn amazing and realistic. A must visit place.

I have finally discovered a treasure trove in Chandigarh.
This Government Museum of art and architecture is like a hidden gem which I guess many are unaware of.
A friend mentioned about this institution in Sector 10 in the passing and I decided to check this out on a weekday.
The building, the presentation, the collection -- it blew away my mind.

Basically there are three important buildings -- one is dedicated to Architecture, the other to Natural History and the last one is dedicated to art, paintings and sculptures.

Everything is very well placed in spacious halls, very well marked and labelled. At most of the installations and paintings the descriptions are both in English and in Braille. It's so heartening to see the thoughtfulness in even the layout as ramps help in the movements of wheel chair bound art connoisseurs

The charges are minimal and you can even ask for a guide. A few hours spent here is just like touching the tip of the iceberg. I guess many more trips to the various sections of the museum should be planned in order to know and appreciate our art, culture and heritage.

It was so nice to see a batch of young school children being taken around -- an early awareness will help them mould well.
A word for the staff -- very polite and helpful. They are certainly an asset to the museum.
Looking forward to many more trips of discovery to this wonderful place

places.address: Sector, 10C, Sector 10, Chandigarh, 160011, India

places.generalDescription: The Open Hand Monument, situated in the Capitol Complex of Chandigarh, is a significant architectural creation by the renowned architect Le Corbusier. This iconic 85-foot structure features a large hand with an open palm, symbolizing peace, unity, and acceptance of new ideas. Designed to represent the positive aspects of the city, it stands as a prominent landmark and embodies the theme of peace and reconciliation. The monument's symbolic significance extends beyond Chandigarh to captivate visitors from around the world.

sources.snippet: This giant public sculpture looks like a cross between a flying dove and an open hand, and has become the symbol of the city.
sources.shortName: Chandigarh Sightseeing | Chandigarh Attractions

sources.snippet: The Open Hand Monument, located in the Capitol Complex of Chandigarh, is an iconic symbol and architectural masterpiece designed by the renowned architect Le Corbusier. Heavily incorporating concepts of The Fibonacci Series and the Golden Ratio in his dream monument, the official emblem of Chandigarh was made with the sole idea that it would represent everything good about the city. This symbolic structure holds immense significance, not just for Chandigarh but also for the entire architectural world.
sources.shortName: Most Remarkable Monuments In Chandigarh

sources.snippet: The Open Hand structure is another famous landmark designed by the famous architect Le Corbusier. It is one of the renowned attractions in the Capitol Complex and holds a remarkable sight for the tourists. This symbolic monument defines ‚Äòthe hand to give and the hand to take, peace and prosperity, and the unity of mankind‚Äô.
sources.shortName: Secretariat Building, Chandigarh, India: Facts, Architecture

places.name: The Open Hand Monument

reviews.text:
The Open Hand Monument in Chandigarh is one of the most iconic structures designed by Le Corbusier, the architect of the city. Located in Capitol Complex, this 26-meter-high metal structure symbolizes peace, unity, and the exchange of ideas. The hand is designed to rotate with the wind, representing openness to change and progress.

The monument is not just an architectural marvel but also holds deep philosophical meaning, reflecting Chandigarh's spirit as a modern and progressive city. If you're interested in architecture, history, or just want to see something unique, it's definitely worth a visit. Plus, the entire Capitol Complex is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, adding to its significance.

This is a wonderful construction french architect , This was a symbol of peace , friendship and safe...in another way it seems like a flying bird..It was a weight of 50tons and even on this weight it rotates 360¬∞very easily.For easy rotation it need equal weight and balance, that is the talent of the architect. This site in Chandigarh is UNESCO certified site...they are other 5 monuments in the same site with unic architecture...
It's in a high security area as its high court assembly is there. We have to take permission from authorities.

places.address: 31, Uttar Marg, Capitol Complex, Sector 1, Chandigarh, 160001, India

places.generalDescription: The Capitol Complex Tourist Center is a remarkable destination nestled within the sprawling 100-acre government compound in Chandigarh, India. Designed by the renowned architect Le Corbusier, this UNESCO World Heritage Site showcases his architectural genius through iconic structures like the High Court and Secretariat, alongside the striking Open Hand Monument. Visitors can immerse themselves in guided tours that highlight not only these stunning buildings but also their breathtaking backdrop of the Shivalik hills.

sources.snippet: While the Capitol Complex has the city‚Äôs most awe-inspiring structures, all of the government buildings are actually used for government business. This is not a museum, but a guided tour through Chandigarh‚Äôs court system, which you must apply for in advance. The tour starts at the welcome center, where you‚Äôll have to turn over your passport and go through a metal detector.
sources.shortName: The Most Incredible Architecture by Le Corbusier in India

sources.snippet: Capitol Complex | #3 of 12 Best Historical Places in Chandigarh. If you simply go by dates, the Capitol Complex may not qualify as one of the historical places to visit in Chandigarh. But it was granted the status of UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2016 to honor the architectural brilliance displayed by Le Corbusier ‚Äì the architect who planned the city of Chandigarh.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Chandigarh with Location & Entry Fee

places.name: Capitol Complex Tourist Center

reviews.text: This is a welcome addition for many of the locals who may never have seen the very discreetly done wonderful work that has put Chandigarh as part of the UNESCO world heritage list. Although I visited in sweltering weather, try scheduling a spring/autumn/winter visit to see a spectacular part of the city. Entry free but by appointment as a lot of this area isn't open to public and you need to provide ID proof.

Le Corbusier's famous architecture. Although avoid visiting during weekends as the buildings remain closed and can't be seen from inside. It is a pity that Punjab tourism can't keep them during weekends for the tourists, as tourists prefer to visit during weekends.
This was an incredibly insightful experience. The guide was informative and helpful. This is a must-do activity when visiting Chandigarh (only runs certain times of the day, 15:00 is the last entry).

places.address: HIGH COURT, Capitol Complex, Sector 1, Chandigarh, 160001, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a serene suburb of Chandigarh, the Pierre Jeanneret Museum stands as a tribute to the visionary architect who played a pivotal role in shaping this vibrant city. As Le Corbusier's cousin and collaborator, Jeanneret was instrumental in designing the residential sectors while living here long after the Capitol Complex Project concluded. The museum exudes Mid-Century Modern charm with its chic spiral staircase, polished cement floors, and expansive windows that flood the space with natural light.

sources.snippet: In a leafy suburb of Chandigarh, there‚Äôs a new museum that pays homage to another creative mind that helped shaped the city‚ÄîPierre Jeanneret, Le Corbusier‚Äôs cousin and frequent collaborator. While Le Corbusier designed the flashy government buildings, Jeanneret was in charge of the residential sectors of the city, living in Chandigarh as the chief architect of the city long after the Capitol Complex Project was finished. The Mid-Century Modern museum feels chic and somehow timeless, with a spiral staircase, cement floors, and large windows that let in tons of light.
sources.shortName: The Most Incredible Architecture by Le Corbusier in India

places.name: Pierre Jeanneret Museum

reviews.text: Fascinating space. On our recent trip from Dehradun this was one of the places on our itenary. Inspiring place & the stone wall at the entrance has had an interesting effect on you as a visitor. It makes you realise how small you are but also grounds you strangely enough!

A decent, clean and subtle museum. A home of a designer turned into a museum. It's nice and peaceful. The staff is also nice.

Most of The Times we think that There are no places to explore in Chandigarh.

If you check out the website of Chandigarh Tourism you will come across A few hidden places That are unexplored . This is one of those places. This museum is so beautiful and it is made in the memory of the designer you can say who designed the city beautiful. He was the 1 who lived here. This is why they have turned the whole bungalow into the museum in his memory.

You can easily check out all his creations at his home. There is also the availability of guest rooms at this museum. It is really very peaceful and a divine experience if you are staying in Chandigarh plus it is budget friendly too.

No fee. For staying, Rs 1500-2500. Discounts for architects and designers are applicable.

Heritage bungalow of Chandigarh. Environment friendly building is made of concrete , stone . No use of bricks. Unique building. Museum cum Guest house having 03 rooms , Govt. of Chandigarh property. Nice living.

places.address: 57, Uttar Marg, Sukhna Lake, Sector 5, Chandigarh, 160005, India

places.generalDescription: The Tower of Shadows, also known as the Shadow Tower, is a remarkable architectural structure in Chandigarh, India. Designed by the renowned architect Le Corbusier, it stands as a testament to his innovative approach to sun control and study of solar movements. This historical site is part of the Capitol Complex, which includes imposing concrete buildings like the High Court and Secretariat. The tower's purpose was to create shade and allow for natural ventilation while showcasing captivating shadows created by harnessing natural light.

sources.snippet: The Tower of Shadows, outside the Secretariat building, is like a sculpture you‚Äôre allowed to hang out in. Built to create shade and let in a breeze, the structure is an oddly light and peaceful place amongst the heavy buildings in the Capitol Complex.
sources.shortName: The Most Incredible Architecture by Le Corbusier in India

sources.snippet: This airy, partially-open pavilion is a symbolic structure traces the path of the sun through shadows, which are cast both inside and outside the tower.
sources.shortName: Chandigarh Sightseeing | Chandigarh Attractions

sources.snippet: Also known as the Shadow Tower, the Tower of Shadows is a testament to Corbusier's innovative approach to sun control. The tower stands as a testament to his innovative architectural style. Designed to study solar movements, this architectural gem showcases how natural light can be harnessed to create captivating shadows and maintain comfortable temperatures within the building.
sources.shortName: Most Remarkable Monuments In Chandigarh

places.name: The Tower of Shadows - Chandigarh, India

reviews.text:
The Capitol Complex has distinctive features that make it recognisable in my eyes; the three pillars of democracy of the High Court; the distinguished Open Hand and its deep amphitheatre; the colourful entry gate of the Palace of Assembly; the sun diagram on the Geometric Hill; and the monkeys on the Tower of Shadows.

Speaking of, I admire Le Corb's artistic expression, to study light and shadow and implement them into the Capitol Complex while planning the city, is symbol in itself.

However, despite the admiration of his art, the Complex does occupy expansive space that seem unnecessary, apart from a grandeur aesthetic.

The Tower Shadows is one of the four monuments at the Capitol complex designed by Le Corbusier

The structure is designed in such a way that during Summers no sun light enters it and during winters it is full of warm sunlight

It casts shows in different lengths
What a beautiful place of the tower of shadows. I would tell you all to definitely come here once and enjoy this place, I had a very good experience here‚ù§Ô∏èüòå.

places.address: Capitol Complex, Sector 1, Chandigarh, 160001, India

places.generalDescription: The Le Corbusier Centre, located in Sector 19-B, Chandigarh, was once the workplace of the renowned architect Le Corbusier. It is a historic building that holds a large collection of old documents, sketches, and photos showcasing his work as the city's chief architect. Visitors interested in urban planning, architecture, and design will find this center appealing.

sources.snippet: While the whole city was planned by Le Corbusier and his team, the most significant and iconic buildings in Chandigarh are all government buildings in the administrative sector of the city, called the Capital Complex. However, this museum (although not part of the Capital Complex) is the best place to start your architecture tour of Chandigarh. In Le Corbusier‚Äôs old office, Le Corbusier Centre has exhibits on the city‚Äôs buildings and the life of the famous architect.
sources.shortName: The Most Incredible Architecture by Le Corbusier in India

sources.snippet: The best place to discover the stories behind Chandigarh's most iconic buildings, this museum traces the making of the city through the work of its chief architect, Le Corbusier.
sources.shortName: Chandigarh Sightseeing | Chandigarh Attractions

sources.snippet: Le Corbusier Centre | #4 of 12 Best Historical Places in Chandigarh. As the name indicates, Le Corbusier Centre is dedicated to the architect who gave the city of Chandigarh its planned look. In fact, this center is the very place where the architect and his team had once planned the entire city‚Äôs design.
sources.shortName: 12 Top Historical Places in Chandigarh with Location & Entry Fee

sources.snippet: It was like a dream come true to visit the city designed by Le Corbusier. I am an inquisitive person with a desire to learn, and I always enjoy the feeling of being guided, showing me new worlds and possibilities. The Altrim guide books are like that.
sources.shortName: Chandigarh architectonical travel guide, emblematic buildings, Indian city

places.name: Le Corbusier Centre

reviews.text: A simple museum with details on Mr LeCorbusier and his contribution in the design of Chandigarh city. There is a souvenir shop too in the campus. Good place to spend an hour or so
Creating a most beautiful city needed an architect with a vision and passion. This center captures the man, the process and the history behind Le Corbusier and Chandigarh.

This place is usually less crowded. And it's a must visit for the Art and Design enthusiasts. This is the iconic place where Le Corbusier designed the iconic city of Chandigarh. You get to know about the history and the thought that went behind building the city. Sadly this model was never multiplied in India.

The place also has a open garden cafe, a little pricy but decent food.

places.address: Sector 19B Old Architect Building, Madhya Marg, Chandigarh, 160019, India

i am absolutely thrilled with the interior design work done by  Kama Design Studio! They recently designed two bedrooms for me, and the result is stunning. Ms Kashish took the time to understand my style and preferences, and her creativity and expertise shone through in every aspect of the design.

The attention to detail, the color palette, and the furniture selection all came together to create two beautiful and functional bedrooms. I couldn't be happier with the final result!

I highly recommend Kama Design Studio to anyone looking for a talented,professional and personally approachable interior designer.

After doing a lot of research we have decided to go with Kama Design Studio for the Interiors of our Flat & I would say It was the best decision till date .
Kashish & the team provided us very creative and unique architectural designs for the spaces in our home.

Each room has its own distinct character, yet there's an undeniable sense of cohesion that ties everything together. It's like a symphony of design elements that harmonize to create a masterpiece. They were very much aligned with our requirements and adhere to the clients feedback .
"Whoever visits our flat, loves it very much, especially the color combinations and luxury look"

places.name: Chandigarh College of Architecture, CHD.

reviews.text: CCA-Chandigarh College of Architecture is a Panjab University-affiliated college in Chandigarh. CCA provides sophisticated amenities to its pupils. This campus is lush green and sophisticated in design.

The Chandigarh College of Architecture (or CCA) is a college imparting education and research in the field of architecture. It covers the north-western region of India including the states of Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu & Kashmir as well as the Union Territory of Chandigarh. The college has an enrolment of 200 undergraduates.Chandigarh College of Architecture was established on 7 August 1961 in Chandigarh, India, and was set up to impart education in architecture. Le Corbusier, who developed Chandigarh's master plan in 1951, got CCA established as a part of the Chandigarh Experiment.The college offers a five-year program leading to the degree of Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch) for which it is affiliated to the Panjab University in the Faculty of Design and Fine Arts. A semester system has been in place since 1972. A two-tier scheme has been in effect from 1985. The 10 semester course is offered in two tiers: Stage One, from first to sixth semester or three years and Stage Two, from seventh to tenth semester or two years. Stage One consists of theoretical subjects, tutorials, workshop practice and studio work for a basic grounding in the knowledge about architecture and its tools and skills. Stage Two comprises a six-month practical training followed by a large number of elective courses and studies of urban design, professional practice, town-planning and a thesis. In 1998, the program was modified to introduce more interdisciplinary courses and upcoming themes like building automation and sustainable design.

A college designed by one of the architectural legends himself. A treat for the eyes, the campus is enticing as it unfolds itself as one enters and walks through the courtyard and corridors. The library houses a collection of rare and insightful books.
Counted among the best Architecture schools in the country, the college is a must visit

places.name: Anudeep Bhandari & Associates

reviews.text:
Around 6 years back, had engaged Mr. Bhandari for civil work and complete interiors of my new flat at Gurugram. Some of the things, I would like to highlight...

1. Fantastic work, they spent good time getting and understanding of our taste and then planned things accordingly.

2. Practical - there were so many things which looked better but would have given problems in long run.. their practical approach towards solutions helped avoid those issues.. writing this review after living at the flat for 5 years and with great confidence, engaging with them again for a new assignment.

3. Normally, I have seen with my friends, they end up extensively over their initially planned budget.. not exactly the case here... that too without compromising any quality or refusing some last minute requested changes..

4. Good team and frequent governance even on outstation projects... kept my personal involvement to minimal - mostly on design approvals...

5. Professionalism in overall approach... plans / designs for everything, approval by us, etc.. etc...

Overall fantastic work...

I feel short of words to express my thanks to Mr Anudeep Bhandari.My association with him and his company is 7 years old ,when I got a reference of him through one of my dentist friends. I was shifting to my new place of practice,so within one meeting itself ,we finilised the things.As per the agreement,Mr Bhandari was supposed to visit my Clinic 'N' number of times and by the end of project,Mr Bhandari visited my place almost twice and used to personally supervise things besides being so busy.His team is nearly Perfect,organised and really good to work with.
Our clinic renovation was finished before the deadline...and I still remember Mr Bhandari spending nearly all day there before my inauguration .
It is one of the most aesthetically desighned clinic and I give all credid to my architect...and I allowed him to plan and execute things as he wanted.
Recently I came to know that Mr Bhandari has renovated Sector 34 Gurudwara sahib...and everybody has a word of praise and I feel very proud of being associated with Mr Bhandari.God bless you sir.
